g901.definition: [βαθύς] from the base of {{g939}}; profound (as going down), literally or figuratively

g902.definition: [βαΐον] a diminutive of a derivative probably of the base of {{g939}}; a palm twig (as going out far)

g903.definition: [Βαλαάμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h1109}}); Balaam, a Mesopotamian (symbolic of a false teacher)

g904.definition: [Βαλάκ] of Hebrew origin ({{h1111}}); Balak, a Moabite

g905.definition: [βαλάντιον] probably remotely from {{g906}} (as a depository); a pouch (for money)

g906.definition: [βάλλω] a primary verb; to throw (in various applications, more or less violent or intense) Compare {{g4496}}.

g907.definition: [βαπτίζω] from a derivative of {{g911}}; to immerse, submerge; to make whelmed (i.e. fully wet); used only (in the New Testament) of ceremonial ablution, especially (technically) of the ordinance of Christian baptism

g910.definition: [Βαπτιστής] from {{g907}}; a baptizer, as an epithet of Christ's forerunner

g911.definition: [βάπτω] a primary verb; to whelm, i.e. cover wholly with a fluid; in the New Testament only in a qualified or special sense, i.e. (literally) to moisten (a part of one's person), or (by implication) to stain (as with dye)

g912.definition: [Βαραββᾶς] of Chaldee origin ({{h1347}} and {{h5}}); son of Abba; Bar-abbas, an Israelite

g913.definition: [Βαράκ] of Hebrew origin ({{h1301}}); Barak, an Israelite

g914.definition: [Βαραχίας] of Hebrew origin ({{h1296}}); Barachias (i.e. Berechijah), an Israelite

g915.definition: [βάρβαρος] of uncertain derivation; a foreigner (i.e. non-Greek)

g918.definition: [Βαρθολομαῖος] of Chaldee origin ({{h1247}} and {{h8526}}); son of Tolmai; Bar-tholomæus, a Christian apostle

g919.definition: [Βαριησοῦς] of Chaldee origin ({{h1247}} and {{h3091}}); son of Jesus (or Joshua); Bar-jesus, an Israelite

g920.definition: [Βαριωνᾶς] of Chaldee origin ({{h1247}} and {{h3124}}); son of Jonas (or Jonah); Bar-jonas, an Israelite

g921.definition: [Βαρνάβας] of Chaldee origin ({{h1247}} and {{h5029}}); son of Nabas (i.e. prophecy); Barnabas, an Israelite

g922.definition: [βάρος] probably from the same as {{g939}} (through the notion of going down; compare {{g899}}); weight; in the New Testament only, figuratively, a load, abundance, authority

g923.definition: [Βαρσαβᾶς] of Chaldee origin ({{h1247}} and probably {{h6634}}); son of Sabas (or Tsaba); Bar-sabas, the name of two Israelites

g924.definition: [Βαρτιμαῖος] of Chaldee origin ({{h1247}} and {{h2931}}); son of Timæus (or the unclean); Bar-timæus, an Israelite

g926.definition: [βαρύς] from the same as {{g922}}; weighty, i.e. (fig) burdensome, grave

g931.definition: [βάσανος] perhaps remotely from the same as {{g939}} (through the notion of going to the bottom); a touch-stone, i.e. (by analogy) torture

g932.definition: [βασιλεία] from {{g935}}; properly, royalty, i.e. (abstractly) rule, or (concretely) a realm (literally or figuratively)

g935.definition: [βασιλεύς] probably from {{g939}} (through the notion of a foundation of power); a sovereign (abstractly, relatively, or figuratively)

g937.definition: [βασιλικός] from {{g935}}; regal (in relation), i.e. (literally) belonging to (or befitting) the sovereign (as land, dress, or a courtier), or (figuratively) preeminent

g939.definition: [βάσις] from βαίνω (to walk); a pace ("base"), i.e. (by implication) the foot

g940.definition: [βασκαίνω] akin to {{g5335}}; to malign, i.e. (by extension) to fascinate (by false representations)

g941.definition: [βαστάζω] perhaps remotely derived from the base of {{g939}} (through the idea of removal); to lift, literally or figuratively (endure, declare, sustain, receive, etc.)

g942.definition: [βάτος] of uncertain derivation; a brier shrub

g943.definition: [βάτος] of Hebrew origin ({{h1324}}); a bath, or measure for liquids

g945.definition: [βαττολογέω] from Βάττος (a proverbial stammerer) and {{g3056}}; to stutter, i.e. (by implication) to prate tediously

g948.definition: [βδελύσσω] from a (presumed) derivative of βδέω (to stink); to be disgusted, i.e. (by implication) detest (especially of idolatry)

g949.definition: [βέβαιος] from the base of {{g939}} (through the idea of basality); stable (literally or figuratively)

g952.definition: [βέβηλος] from the base of {{g939}} and βηλός (a threshold); accessible (as by crossing the door-way), i.e. (by implication, of Jewish notions) heathenish, wicked

g954.definition: [Βεελζεβούλ] of Chaldee origin (by parody on {{h1176}}); dung-god; Beelzebul, a name of Satan

g955.definition: [Βελίαλ] of Hebrew origin ({{h1100}}); worthlessness; Belial, as an epithet of Satan

g956.definition: [βέλος] from {{g906}}; a missile, i.e. spear or arrow

g957.definition: [βελτίον] neuter of a compound of a derivative of {{g906}} (used for the comparative of {{g18}}); better

g958.definition: [Βενιαμίν] of Hebrew origin ({{h1144}}); Benjamin, an Israelite

g959.definition: [Βερνίκη] from a provincial form of {{g5342}} and {{g3529}}; victorious; Bernice, a member of the Herodian family

g960.definition: [Βέροια] perhaps a provincial from a derivative of {{g4008}} (Perœa, i.e. the region beyond the coast-line); Berœa, a place in Macedonia

g961.definition: [Βεροιαῖος] from {{g960}}; a Berœoean or native of Berœa

g962.definition: [Βηθαβαρά] of Hebrew origin ({{h1004}} and {{h5679}}); ferry-house; Bethabara (i.e. Bethabarah), a place on the Jordan

g963.definition: [Βηθανία] of Chaldee origin; date-house; Beth-any, a place in Palestine

g964.definition: [Βηθεσδά] of Chaldee origin (compare {{h1004}} and {{h2617}}); house of kindness; Beth-esda, a pool in Jerusalem

g965.definition: [Βηθλεέμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h1036}}); Bethleem (i.e. Beth-lechem), a place in Palestine

g966.definition: [Βηθσαϊδά] of Chaldee origin (compare {{h1004}} and {{h6719}}); fishing-house; Bethsaida, a place in Palestine

g967.definition: [Βηθφαγή] of Chaldee origin (compare {{h1004}} and {{h6291}}); fig-house; Beth-phage, a place in Palestine

g968.definition: [βῆμα] from the base of {{g939}}; a step, i.e. foot-breath; by implication, a rostrum, i.e. a tribunal

g970.definition: [βία] probably akin to {{g979}} (through the idea of vital activity); force

g971.definition: [βιάζω] from {{g970}}; to force, i.e. (reflexively) to crowd oneself (into), or (passively) to be seized

g976.definition: [βίβλος] properly, the inner bark of the papyrus plant, i.e. (by implication) a sheet or scroll of writing

g977.definition: [βιβρώσκω] a reduplicated and prolonged form of an obsolete primary verb (perhaps causative of {{g1006}}); to eat

g978.definition: [Βιθυνία] of uncertain derivation; Bithynia, a region of Asia

g979.definition: [βίος] a primary word; life, i.e. (literally) the present state of existence; by implication, the means of livelihood

g981.definition: [βίωσις] from {{g980}}; living (properly, the act, by implication, the mode)

g982.definition: [βιωτικός] from a derivative of {{g980}}; relating to the present existence

g984.definition: [βλάπτω] a primary verb; properly, to hinder, i.e. (by implication) to injure

g985.definition: [βλαστάνω] from βλαστός (a sprout); to germinate; by implication, to yield fruit

g986.definition: [Βλάστος] perhaps the same as the base of {{g985}}; Blastus, an officer of Herod Agrippa

g987.definition: [βλασφημέω] from {{g989}}; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously

g989.definition: [βλάσφημος] from a derivative of {{g984}} and {{g5345}}; scurrilious, i.e. calumnious (against men), or (specially) impious (against God)

g990.definition: [βλέμμα] from {{g991}}; vision (properly concrete; by implication, abstract)

g991.definition: [βλέπω] a primary verb; to look at (literally or figuratively) Compare {{g3700}}.

g992.definition: [βλητέος] from {{g906}}; fit to be cast (i.e. applied)

g993.definition: [Βοανεργές] of Chaldee origin ({{h1123}} and {{h7266}}); sons of commotion; Boanerges, an epithet of two of the apostles

g994.definition: [βοάω] apparently a prolonged form of a primary verb; to halloo, i.e. shout (for help or in a tumultuous way)

g995.definition: [βοή] from {{g994}}; a halloo, i.e. call (for aid, etc.)

g996.definition: [βοήθεια] from {{g998}}; aid; specially, a rope or chain for frapping a vessel

g998.definition: [βοηθός] from {{g995}} and theo (to run); a succorer

g999.definition: [βόθυνος] akin to {{g900}}; a hole (in the ground); specially, a cistern

g1000.definition: [βολή] from {{g906}}; a throw (as a measure of distance)
